review_blob: Huge thanks to Alle & Livingstone. Beautiful dark pink little hazy with no head. Aroma is very strong of grapes, and in particular of peels. Lovely funkiness underneath. The sourness is balanced and the fruitiness is perceivable. Drying effect. Delicious.

Huge thanks to Leo. Wow, this shit smells wonderful.  Almonds, vanilla and rice, in the best acceptation possible. Round and warm, inviting. The last glass develop a little ethylic touch. Remains very elegant. Forget to mention that is golden and very clear. The flavour is sweet, with a quite dry end.

Thanks to Andr. Black with a beige creamy yet vanishing head. Aroma is very nice, balsamic, with the obvious roasted features and a vanilla touch.  Flavourful, creamy, with a slight warming bitter end.
Thanks to Andr. Pours dark amber with a vanishing beige head. Aroma is definitely sweet, too sweet, and nutty. Flavourwise it sucks. Nothing to add. Not my beer.

Thanks to Andr. Beautiful orange colour with a nice frothy white head. It smells of burnt sugar and flowery hops. Warming mouthfeel, a bit rough, is definitely way sweeter than I expected. Quite a good brew nevertheless.

Huge thanks to Andreas. Clear pale with a nice white head. The aroma is delicate, floral, spicy and herbal with just a touch of malt sweetness. The alcohol is perfectly hidden and the palate is very smooth. Lovely as every Andreas beer.
Thanks Andr. Nice smooth smoky character with a chestnut sweetness and just an hint of juniper. Is warming and velvety, sweet without being cloying. Lovely stuff.

Pours black with a huge creamy lasting brown head. The aroma is strong roasted malt, with a distinctive smoky accent. Quite full bodied, with strong chocolate flavour and the bite of chili increasingly warming the mouth. Lovely thou a bit rough.

Bottle @DomusBirrae. Black with a thin cappuccino head. Light roasted, milk chocolate with a subtle smokey note. Taste is medium sweet with a roasted coffee and choco roundness. Easy thou quite flavourful.
Clear amber with a huge dense white head. The aroma is deliciously piny and grapefruity, with some sweet malt undertones. Fruity flavour with a massive bitterness. Mind-blowing.
Bright amber with a rocky white head. The aroma is strong hoppy, resinous and citric. It has a fruity caramel taste with a powerful lasting bitter note.
Light amber with vanishing head. The nose is lovely fruity and funky, the flavour is dry, berry-ish with a mellow sour dry end. Very nice unusual brew.

Golden with a little vanishing white head. The aroma is dominated by a sweet flowery honey note while the gueuze counterpart is little noticeable but for a subtle leathery note. The flavour is sweet and very leathery.
Pit black with little brown head. The aroma is roasted and somewhat spicy. The flavour is smooth, rich malty, very easy to drink with notes of licorice, chocolate and caramel.

The aroma is lovely. Really a nice and complex one, with malts and yeast perfectly combining in a spicy, honey, ripe fruit and chocolate orgy. The flavour is less intriguing, but still very good. Definitely not a stout, thou.

A really rocky white head on a bright golden ale. The aroma is weak, with some honey and spicy yeast. Is a clear straight ale, perhaps refreshing and of course correctly brewed. Nothing more than this. Lacks personality.
Unclear amber with a off white lasting head. Strong citrus and caramel nose, some yeasty notes. Flavourwise is densely sweet & bitter. Nothing new under the sun.

Deep red with a nice head. Aroma is malty with berry tartness as well as a clear wood note. The brandy touch is perceivable but not disturbing nor overwhelming. Flavourwise is sweet with a moderate lingering sourness. Wood, berry, caramel, vinous. Carbonation is soft. Warming.
beer_name: Mikkeller Weinbrand Barrel Aged Red Ale

review_blob: Bright golden with some fast disappearing white bubbled head. Nose has  apricot notes as well as a nice wild tang reminded me of a well aged Orval, plus a citric honey-ish touch. Well attenuated, spicy with a soft carbonation. A really nice beer when properly aged.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Pit black with a lovely lasting thick brown head. Chocolate, ashes, vanilla, some oak, a burnt note in the end. Is a luscious, thick, flavourful roasted experience.
A nice pink-red with barely no head. The aroma is vinyl, red fruits, some vinegar. The taste is extremely sour, harsh and dry. Lack elegance.
Cloudy golden with a fast disappearing head. Peculiar BFM sour nose a bit overwhelmed by a strong clove note. The flavour is spicy and sour, lemon dry.
Unclear greyish golden with nice head. Fruity, yeasty odd nose. Tart and bit astringency. Messy.
Thanks Laurent. Strong cherry aroma developing in some oak leathery vanilla character warming up. Quite hidden ABV, strong complex fruity sourness. Very good.

beer_name: Dieu du Ciel Corne du Diable

review_blob: Thanks to Laurent for sharing. The aroma is like a wild strong lambic, with a peculiar apricot note when it warms up in the glass. Lacto sourness, caramel, chocolate, red fruits. Complex and lovely.
Tap @ Lago Lodge. Pours dark brown with little head. Perhaps served a little too carbonated. Lovely malt aroma. Flavourful, dry. Caramel, hints of chocolate.

Tap at The Dome. Nice light amber with a huge creamy lasting white head. The aroma is dominated by a nice fresh yeast note, with some spices and a subtle sweet malt accent. The flavour is malty, peachy, spicy. Lovely dry.
A lovely low ABV beer, packed with hop flavour and aroma, without being unbalanced. Peachy and citrusy. Loved it.

From the cask @ Schlenkerla in Bamberg. Dark with a off-white head. Nice smoky tone, with some caramel and chocolate notes. The beer is sweet but not cloying, at least for me as my fellow guys dont feel the same. A lovely strong wintry brew.
Pours bright orange with a lasting thick white head. Smells like sweet orange, with some resinous hop touch back. Very balanced and flavourful, for me one of the best IPA ever had.

Pours copper with a nice white disappearing head. The nose is extremely elegant, with funky notes, candi sugar and some cereal hints. Sourness is very balanced. Love it. Unfortunately I get only one bottle in Belgium...

Tap @Moeder Fontainas and @ The Dome. My God, this is the ultimate kriek experience!! Smells like tons of fresh cherries squeezed in some funky wood. The flavour is oustanding, very elegant for being a Cantillon (dont get this wrong), massive sweet and sour cherry blast.

Huge thanks to Jean @Moeder for sharing this gem. Clear light amber with a vanishing off-white head. Strong tart cherry aroma, mingling with some leathery woody and lacto notes. Very intriguing as for flavour, starting fruity sweet and than developing in a very long drying sour complex and lingering end.

Bottle shared with the guys @ The Dome. Tar black with a nice brown thick lasting head.
The nose is nothing but an ethyl punch. After a while some ash, tar & burnt coffee appear. Inviting? No.
Carbonated, hard to swallow. Licking some tarmac would be nicer, I guess.
Tap @ White Horse. Hazy golden. Lemony with some nice notes of Brett. Some lactic? Its sour, of course, but rather balanced and fruity. Very nice, Id expected it to be way worst than it really is.

Shared with the guys @ The Dome. Deepest black Ive ever seen with a huge lasting creamy brown head. Nice and strong coffee aroma, with hints of vanilla, chocolate and some sweetness  undertones. Chewy, dense, fulfilling. Sweetness and bitterness chase each other to a last long lovely embrace.
beer_name: Great Divide Yeti Imperial Stout - Espresso Oak Aged

review_blob: Cask @ The White Horse, SW6. Black indeed with a little tan disappearing head. All the roasted malt related stuff in there, balanced and lovely. Could drink gallons.
@TheWhiteHorseSW6 and @4:20. Very nice hoppy Ale with a very elegant hoppy nose and a intriguing yet simple flavour palette. Lovely bitter dry end.
Cask@GBBF 2010. Another nice sessionable Golden Ale. Balanced and quenching. Nothing more than this.
Cask @ GBBF10. Clear straw and a white thick persistent head. Nose is hoppy, a bit citrusy and flowery. Some nice honey notes from malt. Very quaffable and quenching.
Bottle. This is pure goodness. Thank God Ive some other bottles in my cellar. Unfathomably deep and complex. A vinous, fruity, slightly leathery gem.
beer_name: Birrificio del Ducato La Luna Rossa

review_blob: Extremely black with a nice creamy brown coffee-like lasting head. The aroma is not that complex, a bit metallic, with the obvious coffee and chocolate notes. The alcohol is rather perceivable. Has a huge full body, you could eat it with a teaspoon, and a rich silky balanced flavour, a mix of coffee, bitter chocolate, with some occasional ripe cherry and prune notes and a certain balancing sourness. A bitter&sweet; delicious brew.
Pale straw with a lasting thick white head. The aroma is herbal, minty with just an hint of citrusy. The flavour is a bit weak, crispy bitter with herbal notes. Watery. Took 3 swallows. Quenching.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Bottle shared with Michele @ The Dome. 2008. The beer is brown, bright and with burgundy hues, and a cappuccino like veil of foam covers it all. The nose is very intense and complex. Lovely cocoa powder, very vinous, a lot of berries and a slight apricot note, a bit boozy as it warms up. Just a hint of oaky vanilla.  The flavours are a bit overwhelmed by a strong acidity. It is nevertheless very fruity and caramelized, with somewhat leathery notes. Silky and very attenuated. Challenging but  nice.

Golden with pink hues, but barely no head. The perfume is delicate, fruity, hoppy. The flavour is damn good, developing from a sweet fruity note towards a grapefruit peel like bitterness. Its very drinkable and quenching.
Tap @ The Dome. Orange colour and a withe rocky head. The aroma is strong fruity and peppery but lacks that peculiar Saison touch. Medium bodied and far too bitter.
Golden with a rocky white head. Way too sweet, with notes of flowers and honey. Some metallic. Warming.
Bright orange with a nice white head. Nose is dominated by peppery and coriander notes, some citrusy and malty. Very complex despite the limited ABV and the thin body.
At the brewery. Clear mahogany with a nice tan head. Aroma is sweet malty, caramel, sweet chocolate. Flavour of burnt sugar, sweet. Overall nice but nothing special.
